This chunk fits within a section of the document that discusses transformations of 3D objects in Panda3D, specifically focusing on setting and querying position, rotation, and scale properties of node paths. It provides methods for adjusting an object's size uniformly or along individual axes, setting specific components of position, orientation, and scaling, as well as querying current transformation values.

You can change an object's size, either uniformly, or with a different value of x, y, and z.

python

myNodePath.setScale(S)

cpp

myNodePath.set_scale(S);

Sometimes it is convenient to adjust a single component individually:

python

myNodePath.setX(X)
myNodePath.setY(Y)
myNodePath.setZ(Z)
myNodePath.setH(H)
myNodePath.setP(P)
myNodePath.setR(R)
myNodePath.setSx(SX)
myNodePath.setSy(SY)
myNodePath.setSz(SZ)

cpp

myNodePath.set_x(X);
myNodePath.set_y(Y);
myNodePath.set_z(Z);
myNodePath.set_h(H);
myNodePath.set_p(P);
myNodePath.set_r(R);
myNodePath.set_sx(SX);
myNodePath.set_sy(SY);
myNodePath.set_sz(SZ);

Or all at the same time:

python

myNodePath.setPosHprScale(X, Y, Z, H, P, R, SX, SY, SZ)

cpp

myNodePath.set_pos_hpr_scale(X, Y, Z, H, P, R, SX, SY, SZ);

You can also query the current transform information for any of the above:

python

myNodePath.getPos()
myNodePath.getX()
myNodePath.getY()
myNodePath.getZ()

cpp
